author: Special Correspondent
text:
The income tax revenue generated in the country is well utilised for the implementation of various welfare programmes and development works, said M. Tirumala Kumar, Principal Commissioner of Income Tax, Salem.

The Central Government netted revenue of Rs. 7 lakh crore every year through income tax and this money is being spent for the projects concerning education, health and defence departments, said Mr. Tirumala Kumar while speaking at a get-together of income tax assesses of Namakkal range here recently.

While many developed nations collect high rate of income tax, in some Gulf countries there is no tax for the income earned by the people. The income tax rate in India is low.

The Department raised income tax revenue to the tune of Rs. 476 crore in the four districts of Salem, Namakkal, Dharmapuri and Krishnagiri during last fiscal.

Income tax revenue target of Rs. 569 crore has been fixed for the current year in these four districts, Mr. Tirumala Kumar said.

N. Sukumar, Joint Commissioner of Income Tax, Namakkal range and F. A. Yasser Arafat, Assistant Commissioner of Income Tax, Salem, and other officials participated in the programme.
title: Rs. 476 crore collected as IT revenue from four districts
